text: In chemistry, cross-conjugation is a special type of conjugation (a form of connection between two things) in a molecule. When in a set of 3 Pi bonds two pi bonds interact with each other by "conjugation".N. F. Phelan, "Cross Conjugation" in Journal of Chemical Education, 1968 (45/10), 633-637. ==References== == Other websites == * IUPAC definition Category:Organic chemistry
title: Cross-conjugation
